data.taskbar#taskBar:
exports['vc-taskbar']:taskBar(length, name, runCheck?, keepWeapon?, vehicle?, vehCheck?)

length: number
name: string
runCheck?: boolean
vehicle?: boolean
vehicle?: boolean
vehCheck?: boolean

Example:
local finished = exports['vc-taskbar']:taskBar(5000, 'Eating...')
if finished then
-- do something
end

data.promise#Promise:
exports.ghmattimysql:executeSync
exports.ghmattimysql:scalarSync
exports.ghmattimysql:transactionSync

execute response INSERT UPDATE DELETE
{
serverStatus = 2,
changedRows = 0,
insertId = 0,
message = "(Rows matched: 0  Changed: 0  Warnings: 0",
warningCount = 0,
affectedRows = 0,
protocol41 = "true",
fieldCount = 0,
}

data: This is the universal function which will handle most of your requests.
data.promise#Promise:
local response = exports.ghmattimysql:executeSync('SELECT `firstname`, `lastname` FROM `users` WHERE `identifier` = ?', {
identifier
})

if response then
for i = 1, #response do
local row = response[i]
print(row.firstname, row.lastname)
end
end

data: You use this function when you want only a singular value returned. This means you can call it when when selecting exactly one row and one column.

Placeholders allow for query parameters to be safely executed, preventing common SQL injection methods(opens in a new tab).Parameters can be passed an an array or map (referred to as named named parameters).
local identifier = 'license:abc123'
local group = 'admin'

exports.ghmattimysql:scalar('SELECT `username` FROM `users` WHERE `identifier` = ? AND `group` = ?', { identifier, group })

-- Named placeholders (deprecated)
exports.ghmattimysql:scalar('SELECT `username` FROM `users` WHERE `identifier` = @identifier AND `group` = @group', {
group = group
identifier = identifier
})
Welcome to Nextra! This is a basic docs template. You can use it as a starting point for your own project :)

data.isped#isPed:
exports.redem_roleplay:isPed(param)

param: string
cid, job, jobgrade, group

data:
getPlayerFromId or playerModule
local user = exports.redem_roleplay:getPlayerFromId(source)
local user = exports.redem_roleplay:playerModule(source)
data.function#Function:
user.setFirstname(name)
user.setLastname(name)
user.setJob(job)
user.setJobgrade(grade)
user.setOrigin(origin)
user.kick(reason)
data.charinfo#Charinfo:
user.getName()
user.getFirstname()
user.getLastname()
user.getJob()
user.getJobgrade()
user.getOrigin()
user.getDOB()
user.getGender()
user.getPermissions()
user.getIdentifier(i)
user.getGroup()
user.setSessionVar(key, value)
user.getSessionVar('charid')

data.mythic_notify#mythic_notify:
exports['mythic_notify']:SendAlert(type, text, length)

TriggerClientEvent('mythic_notify:client:SendAlert', source, { type = 'inform', text = 'Message', length = 5000 })

type: string
inform blue
succes green
error red


text: string
the message


length?: number
how long is the Notify is showing (default: 5000)
data.setstress#setStress:
exports['vc-hud']:setStress(amount)

amount: number
10 add 10 stress points
-10 remove 10 stress points
max 100

data.stash#Stash:
local cid = exports.redem_roleplay:isPed("cid")
local level = exports['vc-identity'].getLevel()
local stashName = 'banklevel' .. level .. '-' .. cid
local data = {
maxweight = 500
slots = 40
label = 'Stash'
}
TriggerServerEvent("inventory:server:OpenInventory", "stash", stashName, data)
TriggerEvent("inventory:client:SetCurrentStash", stashName)

stashName: string
data?: table
it will overwrite data from data/invindex
data.crafting#Crafting:
TriggerEvent('inventory:client:OpenCraft', craftType, label?)

craftType string
check data/crafting for list


label? string
default is "Crafting"
data.shop#Shop:
TriggerEvent('inventory:client:OpenShop', shopType, label)

craftType string
check data/shops for list


label? string
default is "Shop"

data.additem#AddItem:
Adds an item to player.
exports['vc-inventory']:AddItem(item, count, info, slot)

item: string
The name of the item to add to the target.


count: number
The number of items to add.


info?: table or string
A table of unique data to attach to the item object. A string will create a table with the "type" field.


slot?: number
A specific slot to add the item to. If the slot is invalid, the first available slot will be used instead.
data.removeitem#RemoveItem:
Removes the specified item from player.
exports['vc-inventory']:RemoveItem(item, count, info, slot)

item: string
The name of the item to remove from the target.


count: number
The number of items to remove.


metadata?: table or string
Only remove items with matching metadata properties.


slot?: number
A specific slot to remove the item from. If the slot is invalid, the first available slot will be used instead.
data.example#Example:
-- Add 2 document to the source player with provided information.
exports['vc-inventory']:AddItem('document', 2, {id = 459})

-- Removes 2 document to the source player with provided information.
exports['vc-inventory']:RemoveItem('document', 2, {id = 459})

data.additem#AddItem:
Adds an item to player.
exports['vc-inventory']:AddItem(source, item, count, info, slot)

source: number
The source of the player


item: string
The name of the item to add to the target.


count: number
The number of items to add.


info?: table or string
A table of unique data to attach to the item object. A string will create a table with the "type" field.


slot?: number
A specific slot to add the item to. If the slot is invalid, the first available slot will be used instead.
data.removeitem#RemoveItem:
Removes the specified item from player.
exports['vc-inventory']:RemoveItem(source, item, count, info, slot)

source: number
The source of the player


item: string
The name of the item to remove from the target.


count: number
The number of items to remove.


metadata?: table or string
Only remove items with matching metadata properties.


slot?: number
A specific slot to remove the item from. If the slot is invalid, the first available slot will be used instead.
data.example#Example:
-- Add 2 document to the source player with provided information.
local success = exports['vc-inventory']:AddItem(source, 'document', 2, {id = 459})

-- Removes 2 document to the source player with provided information.
local success = exports['vc-inventory']:RemoveItem(source, 'document', 2, {id = 459})
